quote: “never be sad abot the past. it has alredy hapened and you canot change it. instead, focus on wat truly matters: being sad abot the future. there are many reasons to be sad. u may be sad becuase u feel alone. the comforting thing abot feeling lonely is that evrey thing that has ever existed also knows what loneliness feels like too. u may be sad becuase u are sad. it is ok to be sad. but if you are sad becuase happiness is fleeting, just remember that sadness is also fleeting too. when u are sad, it is ok to let urself be sad. that is ok. evjoy ur sadness. one day even ur sadness will be over too soon”
author:

Everyone's a Aliebn When Ur a Aliebn Too

quote: “Every person who reads your book will be far more likely to be on your side. Books are the most intensive of all current media. People are willing to spend hours and hours with a book.”
author:
Hank Green
An Absolutely Remarkable Thing

quote: “My library was to me an utterly private space that both enclosed and mirrored me.”
author:
Alberto Manguel
Packing My Library: An Elegy and Ten Digressions

see if you can find me a good ice ax. I lost mine.

quote: “Is there anywhere on earth exempt from these swarms of new books? Even if, taken out one at a time, they offered something worth knowing, the very mass of them would be an impediment to learning from satiety if nothing else”
author:
Erasmus
Adages of Erasmus

quote: “She wanted to and believed she could—so she did.”
author:
Jill Telford 
Notes

quote: “MY LIFE MAY NOT BE A FAIRY TALEBUT IT'S A DAMN GOOD READ ”
author:
Qwana M. "BabyGirl" Reynolds-Frasier 
Notes

quote: “A book, like a person, has its fortunes with one; is lucky or unlucky in the precise moment of its falling in our way, and often by some happy accident counts with us for something more than its independent value.”
author:
Walter Pater
Marius the Epicurean

quote: “I couldn’t believe it. It wasn’t just that he knew about Narnia. I could tell that he knew what I meant by a Narnia cubby. It was all there in his eyes. He knew that I didn’t actually think I was Lucy going through a real door to magical lands. He knew that the cubby in the Roadmaster was a sane person’s ticket to freedom of thought.”
author:
Kathryn Lasky
Memoirs of a Bookbat

quote: “Lewat membaca kita bisa bersentuhan dengan seluruh pengalaman manusia: kegembiraan, tragedi, kemenangan, kekalahan, kepahlawanan, dan bahkan keberadaan manusia yang paling dasar, yang paling sepele, dan yang paling biasa-biasa saja.”
author:
Desi Anwar 
Notes

quote: “Syenite brings a truly awful novel someone found on the looted freighter, the sort of thing whose first page made her wince and burst into giggles. Then, of course, she kept reading. She loves books that are just for fun.”
author:
N K Jemisin 
Notes

quote: “Books were faithful and reliable. You could pack them up and put them in a box, run your hands over the spines, flip through their pages full of memories. They always came with you, wherever you went.”
author:
Karen Piper
A Girl's Guide to Missiles: Growing Up in America's Secret Desert

quote: “It’s neither an injury nor a wound but it can leave a scar. Some people do not have to break you to leave a strong mark; they are a lightning of miracle.”
author:
Nicola An
The Universe at Heartbeat

quote: “Membaca itu kegiatan soliter tetapi sekaligus jauh dari kesepian. Kegiatan sederhana yang membuka pikiran kita ke kompleksitas dan kemungkinan tak terbatas; suatu keheningan yang membawa kita ke perjalanan-perjalanan di luar yang dapat kita bayangkan.”
author:
Desi Anwar 
Notes

quote: “Writing is perhaps the greatest of human inventions, binding together people, citizens of distant epochs, who never knew one another. Books break the shackles of time, proof that humans can work magic.”
author:
Carl Sagan
Cosmos

quote: “Many books can inform you, but my book will transform you...”
author:
Ved Nishad 
Notes

quote: “You cannot read all the books of the world, but you can read I Lost My Soul.”
author:
Ved Nishad
I Lost My Soul : An Unbelievable True Love Story

quote: “I still read the books to-day, but never again shall I read them with that old glory of youthful passion when I harked to the call from over and beyond that whispered me on to win to the mystery at the back of life and behind the stars.”
author:
Jack London
John Barleycorn: Alcoholic Memoirs

quote: “With apologies to Kathleen Kelly, what I've come to learn is this: if my real life reminds me of something I read in a book , I'm reading well -- and I'm probably living well, too.”
author:
Anne Bogel

quote: “The footprint of books is everywhere in history, and their visual depiction is―quietly but insistently―everywhere in art.”
author:

quote: “Stories provide a form, a mold. And a good story, one that's retold for generations, demands you pour the messy contents of your own life into it to see what happens as it hardens and sets.”
author:
Liam Callanan (author)
Paris by the Book

quote: “Throw away thy books. No longer distract thyself.”
author:
Marcus Aurelius
Meditations

quote: “Reading is the bridge between the island of ignorance towards the village of wisdom.”

Notes

quote: “What is so refreshing like reading?”
author:

Notes

quote: “...'and I have my mind...and a mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.' Tyrion tapped the leather cover of the book. 'That's why I read so much, Jon Snow.”

quote: “That's really what all books are, isn't it? I mean, lists of secrets and things you only wish you’d done - a sort of deathbed confession where you're trying to get it all out while the lights are still on.”
author:

Notes

quote: “Reading has not gone out of fashion in the last number of years, nor in the ones while you slept in the asteroid belt. Your relatives do not wish to expose themselves to deep thought, lest they be affected by it.”
author:

quote: “In my whole life, I have known no wise people who didn’t read all the time – none, zero.”
author:
